sub_title: Supporting changemakers | Social justice | Women's rights | People vs Inequality Podcast | Atlantic Fellow London School of Economics
summary:
*Supporting changemakers for a more just and sustainable world*

As an independent consultant I build on experience in policy making, research, advocacy and campaigning for social and environmental justice. I enjoy working with committed changemakers and organisations that want to make an even bigger impact by strengthening the evidence-base, strategy or outreach of their work. I create the People vs Inequality podcast and other spaces for reflection on how to shift power for systems change, tackle inequalities and promote economic and climate justice. I am inspired by and always learning from the work of feminist movements across the globe. 

Who am I:
  • Passionate about achieving a more just and sustainable world in which all people are heard, free 'to be and do’ and in which we look after each other and our environment.

    • Experienced analyst, advocate, strategist and organiser for social and environmental justice. Skilled communicator, broker and facilitator for feminist systems change.

    • Expertise on women’s rights and gender equality, land and natural resources, food, climate, corporate accountability, development, human rights, feminist leadership, meaningful participation and civic space.

    • Fluent in Dutch (mother tongue) and English, decent Spanish and Italian, conversational German and French.

profile_positions.description:
Supporting non profit and social justice organisations in research, facilitation and strategy development, with a focus on tackling inequalities and promoting feminist economic and climate justice.

Current work includes:
- Strategy facilitation Inequality (Robert Bosch Stiftung) 
- Facilitating Feminist Economic Justice Dialogues (Edge Funders Alliance)
- Facilitating vision development on Feminist Foreign Policy and Trade (Fair Green Global Alliance)
- Exploring bottom-up knowledge systems for social change (Ideate Grant Atlantic Institute)

Past assignments include:
- Strategy development and stakeholder evaluation on youth participation and SRHR advocacy (CHOICE for youth and sexuality)
- Facilitating strategy development process and (expert) meetings (Inequalities team of the Robert Bosch Stiftung GmbH)
- Scoping study on the gendered impacts of extractive industries and land-based investments and women's responses and a learning document on how to best support this work (Trocaire)
- Report on Women's rights and a Feminist Agenda 2030 for economy, climate, politics and participation (WECF/ Women2030)
- Research for Dutch public television documentary on raw materials (Posvideo/ KRONCRV);
- EU advocacy advisor on food & climate (ActionAid International)
- Field engagement and strategic evaluation on women's economic justice (Wellspring Philantropic Fund)
- Research on feminist foreign policy (Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs)
- Report on UN Women Action Coalition 6 regional meeting on feminist movement building;
- Podcast on Emergent Agency with Oxfam International.
- Research on feminist foreign policies and domestic work/care agenda (Dutch Gender Platform Wo=Men)
- Organizing and co-facilitating learning retreat Inequality (Robert Bosch Stiftung)
- Stakeholder engagement & Practical Guide Academic-Practitioner collaboration in tackling inequalities (AFSEE/LSE)
- Scoping study on just and equitable transdisciplinary collaboration (CUCo)
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Creator and host of the podcast People vs Inequality, a space to reflect and learn with changemakers on how to fight inequality in times of crisis and fast change. So far, we have produced three series exploring urgent strategic questions to turn the tide: one on women's economic justice, one on climate justice and a third one with Oxfam on Emergent Agency in a Time of Covid 19. 

I also develop and support various other initiatives for learning and effective activism / changemaking. This includes writing on the importance of critical (self) reflection, power and strategy and feminist leadership for a range of outlets (e.g. AFSEE blog, ViceVersa, OpenDemocracy). I am also a member of Reimaging INGOs (RINGO) lab, piloting ideas for a more balanced and future-proof global civil society.
profile_positions.title: Writing & podcasting on changemaking

profile_positions.title: Acting Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for effective implementation of policy and campaigns strategies at ActionAid in the Netherlands in joint cooperation with ActionAid and other partners worldwide. Managing a great team working on issues like land rights and food, extractives, climate, tax justice and women's rights. 

Additional roles include:
- External representation: Regularly invited to present in conferences, parliament or universities, as well as participate in (media) interviews. E.g. co-hosted a series of masterclasses on Power, Environment and Globalisation.
- Member of Management Team and co-lead in key organisational processes (eg 10 yr strategy development)
- Partnership development, eg Ministry, other NGOs and Media 
- Supporting team in developing campaign strategies, events, actions and engagement in national and international arena, as well as programme development and partner support.
- Leading outreach on cross-cutting issues such as women's rights, civic space and trade&development debate. 
- NGO representative on the official Dutch Delegation to the Commission on the Status of Women 2018.
profile_positions.title: Head of Policy and Campaigns

profile_positions.description: Working to improve Dutch and EU policies and practices that impact on developing countries, in particular in the field of land governance and women's land rights, incl land-based investments and related policies such as food security, private sector development and biofuels. Coordinating the LandFor campaign in the Netherlands, including research, strategising and advocacy together with European and African partners promoting the right to food, land rights and women's rights within (alternative) policies and investments. Advising and writing for partnership development. (Sr since 10/2014)
profile_positions.title: (Sr) Policy Advisor

profile_positions.description: Policy research for an evaluation of EU Visibility of External Action and the Land chapter of the European Report on Development 2012.
profile_positions.title: Junior Policy Officer DPIR Programme

profile_positions.description:
Facilitating knowledge networks and agenda's on Growth&Equity and on Sustainability,Climate&Energy aiming to bridge the gap between world of knowledge, policy and practice for more effective international cooperation.

As AMID trainee from januari-december 2010 and as Nedworc Consultant from januari-june 2011.
profile_positions.title: Secretariat Knowledge Networks

profile_positions.description: Monitoring and influencing European policies in different areas affecting developing countries, such as trade, migration, agriculture and fisheries. Case work on Intellectual Property Rights & Raw Materials.
profile_positions.title: Policy Assistant Fair Politics EU

profile_positions.description:
Student Assistant (2009): Assistance to Professors in the writing of a re-accreditation and other reports, literature study, administrative tasks.

Mentor and Sponsor Coordinator International Student Network (2005-2006)

Volunteering/ support to various non-profit organisations including Vluchtelingenwerk, IKV Pax, Amnesty.
profile_positions.title: Various student positions at University & Volunteering
